sentence.Network_en: She blench ed before her accuser.
sentence.Network_cn: 她在(她的)指控者面前畏缩了.

sentence.Network_en: According to the law, the accuser, the accused, and the judge were each allowed to talk for the same length of time.
sentence.Network_cn: 按照法律, 每一原告 、 被告及法官都准许有等长的时间发言.

sentence.Network_en: Accuser: No, he calls himself the Son of God!
sentence.Network_cn: 原告: 不, 他称自己为神的儿子!

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(A) ... accuse 控告 accuser 原告 accusing 责难的.
撒但的名字本为控告者(Accuser)。它掌权空中，控告万民。
法律英语专业词汇汇总 ... 抗诉书 protest 控告人 accuser;complainant 跨国诉讼 transnational litigation.
石油词汇英语翻译(AB) ... accused 被告 accuser 谴责者；起诉者 accutron 电子手表.

list.abs: 英文字典_百度文库 ... accusation 罪状;罪名 accuse 控告;指责 accustom 使习惯.
2012年职称英语词汇表最新完整版 - 豆丁网 ... accusation n． 告发，控告 accuse vt． 1． 指责 2．控告 accustom vt． 使习惯.
梵文_百度百科 ... 主格 Nominative 宾格（accusative） Accusative 用格 Instrumental.

entry.def: An accuser is a person who says that another person has done something wrong, especially that he or she has committed a crime.

example.ex: ...a criminal proceeding where defendants have the right to confront their accusers.
example.tran: 被告有权与原告对质的一种刑事诉讼

means.word_mean: 1. someone who imputes guilt or blame
